org.jerkar.api.depmanagement

Class JkDependencyResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.depmanagement.JkDependencyResolver

  • public final class JkDependencyResolver
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to resolve dependencies to files or dependency tree. Resolution is made upon binary repositories.

      • resolve

        public JkResolveResult resolve(JkDependencySet dependencies,
                               JkScope... scopes)
        Resolves the specified dependencies (dependencies declared as module) for the specified scopes.
        Parameters:
        dependencies - the dependencies to resolve.
        scopes - scope for resolution (compile, runtime, ...). If no scope is specified, then it is resolved for all scopes.
        Returns:
        a result consisting in a dependency tree for modules and a set of files for non-module.

      • withModuleHolder

        public JkDependencyResolver withModuleHolder(JkVersionedModule versionedModule)
        The underlying dependency manager can cache the resolution on file ofSystem for faster result. To make this caching possible, you must set the module+version for which the resolution is made. This is only relevant for of dependencies and have no effect for of dependencies.

      • withRepos

        public JkDependencyResolver withRepos(JkRepoSet otherRepos)
        Returns an dependency resolver identical to this one but with the specified repositories.

      • withBasedir

        public JkDependencyResolver withBasedir(java.nio.file.Path baseDir)
        Returns an dependency resolver identical to this one but with specified the base directory. The base directory is used to resolve relative files to absolute files for JkFileSystemDependency. This directory is used by resolve(JkDependencySet, JkScope...) method as it returns only absolute files.

      • getParams

        public JkResolutionParameters getParams()
        Returns the parameters of this dependency resolver.
